sense.name: the bestowing of a franchise, enfranchisment
sense.examples: Jane now has her certification to open her own beauty salon. More than 50 workers signed up for Teamsters' certification.

sense.name: the act of confirming the truth of something
sense.commentary: CERTIFICATION[+event][+cognitive][+confirmation][+of_truth] Note: implies a confirmation of the truth of a situation, Note: does not imply an official pronouncement, (Sense 4)
sense.examples: The pilot would not take off without certification that the cargo door was closed. The certification of such a rare medical condition requires a large battery of tests.

sense.name: official document which attests to the validity of something
sense.examples: The dive shop always asks to see each diver's certification before letting them go out on dives. What types of certification will we need to get our pets back into the country?

sense.name: the act of validating the authenticity of something
sense.commentary: CERTIFICATION[+event][+official][+judgment][+authoritative][+of_authenticity] Note: implies an authority making an official assessment of something's validity or truth
sense.examples: They could not move the corpse until the coroner's certification of the cause of death. The art dealer's certification of the age and origin of this vase is good enough for me.
